answerText: The Posthumous Memoirs of Bras Cubas [or Epitaph for a Small Winner or Memorias Postumas de Bras Cubas][10] The Posthumous Memoirs of Bras Cubas was written by Machado de Assis, an author from this country, also home to the author of Gabriela, Clove, and Cinammon, Jorge Amado.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 6 | 13 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The narrator of this novel recounts his death before telling his life story, and it is dedicated to the first worm that gnawed on the narrator's corpse. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this novel about the title character who loved Virgilia and was friends with Quincas Borba.
